item.title: Sims 4 Survey Hints Possible New Features Coming in Future Updates
item.description:
The Sims 4 has released a survey that allows its fans to vote and make suggestions on new content that could make its way to the base game for free. When The Sims 4 was first released back in September 2014, it wasn't nearly as complete as it is today. For example, back then, babies would immediately grow up into children. Thanks to several updates that have made their way to the game, newborns now age up into infants, then toddlers, and finally children.

Every once in a while, The Sims Team releases major patches that greatly modify the base game, such as The Sims 4 Infant update. Smaller additions are usually made through Sims Delivery Express and hotfixes. Thanks to all the inclusive content that's been introduced to The Sims 4 over the years, players have been able to make much more realistic Sims in Create-a-Sim with additions such as hearing aids, binders, and custom pronouns. They can also now properly celebrate other cultures, as patches have added regional recipes, holidays, and festive items.

Sims 4 Survey Hints at More Free Inclusive Items, Customization Options, and Recipes

There are hundreds of cultures, countries, and customization options that the team still hasn't brought to The Sims 4 , but it seems that the developers haven't given up on the project yet, as a recent survey encourages fans to speak up on what they think is missing in the game. In this survey, the developers ask for fan feedback on what they think should be included in The Sims 4 as "part of free content updates." On Reddit, a fan shared some screenshots of The Sims 4 survey and stated how happy they were that Iranian culture could possibly be coming to the game in a future update.

The wording on the questionnaire makes it clear that the goal is to continue to work towards bringing as many cultures and inclusive features to The Sims 4 and not keep it behind a paywall. While The Sims 4 has been under scrutiny several times due to its extensive library of paid DLCs, it does not force players to pay for its basic, inclusive features.

For example, the Lovestruck expansion pack has a world called Ciudad Enamorada, and it's inspired by Mexican cities. In this case, if players want access to these architectural items in Build Mode, they will have to purchase the expansion pack. However, smaller inclusions, such as recipes like Pao de Queijo, or hearing aids, were all added to the base game for free thanks to the Sims Delivery Express service, content updates, and hotfixes. Hopefully, fans will soon be able to see the additions that they voted for in The Sims 4 , whether it's more gender-neutral representation, holidays and celebrations, or national dishes. Those who are interested in voting and making their own suggestions can do so by accessing the survey link here.

Your comment has not been saved

Unleash your imagination and create a unique world of Sims that’s an expression of you. Download for free, and customize every detail from Sims to homes and much more. Choose how Sims look, act, and dress, then decide how they’ll live out each day. Design and build incredible homes for every family, then decorate with your favorite furnishings and décor. Travel to different neighborhoods where you can meet other Sims and learn about their lives. Discover beautiful locations with distinctive environments and go on spontaneous adventures. Manage the ups and downs of Sims’ everyday lives, and see what happens when you play out scenarios from your own real life. Tell your stories your way while developing relationships, pursuing careers and life aspirations, and immersing yourself in this extraordinary game, where the possibilities are endless

item.title: Pokemon TCG Giving Out Special Promo Pikachu Card
item.description:
The Pokemon Trading Card Game is giving out a special promo Pikachu card to celebrate the annual World Championships, available through the official Pokemon Center store. The beloved trading card game branch of the massively popular monster-catching franchise has seen plenty of excitement throughout the year, with several expansions becoming instant hits. Pokemon Trading Card Game sets like "Prismatic Evolutions" and "Journey Together" have whipped fans into a frenzy, with the Special Illustration Rare Umbreon card from Prismatic Evolutions selling for over $1,000. Now, Pokemon fans could pick up a special new card.

2025 has been a banner year for the Pokemon TCG , with plenty of new sets to excite fans. July saw the release of the game's newest expansion set, with "Black Bolt" and "White Flare" focusing on the Unova region and the franchise's fifth generation. The split set features every single Pokemon introduced in Pokemon Black and White , with each Pokemon also receiving its own Illustration Rare card. Pokemon 's upcoming World Championships tournament is now giving fans the chance to pick up an exclusive new card.

The Pokemon Company officially revealed a special new Pikachu card coming as part of the Pokemon World Championships festivities. During the campaign, players will be able to pick up a new Pikachu promo card with any purchase through the Pokemon Center website. Players will need to input a special code when checking out through Pokemon Center, with "worldscard25us" gifting players with the special promo card. The promotional event is set to run throughout the full week of the Pokemon World Championships, with the tournament taking place during the weekend of August 15-17.

Pokemon TCG Giving Out Worlds Pikachu Promo Card

  • Worlds Pikachu Promo Card included with purchase through Pokemon Center website using special code
  • worldscard25us

The special promo Pikachu card should look to be an enticing offer for fans of the franchise. Pokemon has often offered special promo cards for its annual tournaments, typically featuring artwork and backgrounds based on the location of that year's Pokemon World Championships. The Pokemon Trading Card Game has also typically given out promos for a variety of its special in-person events, including the elusive "Pikachu with Grey Felt Hat" available through an event at the Van Gogh Museum.

Pokemon TCG fans should have lots to look forward to throughout the year, with The Pokemon Company already teasing its next major expansion. "Mega Evolution" will kick off the newest era of the Pokemon Trading Card Game at the end of next month, officially welcoming the return of Mega Pokemon to the TCG. The game has already shown off several exciting full art cards from the set, including fan-favorite Pokemon like Venusaur, Gardevoir, and Lucario among others. The Pokemon TCG looks to maintain its early momentum this year with plenty more on the way.

item.title: Interest in Final Fantasy 14 is Way Down
item.description:
On August 8, the Q1 2025 financial report from Square Enix indicated that Final Fantasy 14 had lost money in both gross sales and operational profits. The downward trend in Final Fantasy 14 also correlated to a decline in player retention year-on-year, as the Dawntrail expansion remained a point of contention between current and former players.

The report came amid a tumultuous time for Final Fantasy 14 . Between various critiques of Dawntrail 's story and patch content pacing, Final Fantasy 14 's monthly subscriber count has steadily decreased. This was further compounded by the notion that Dawntrail followed off the heels of Endwalker , which was the climactic expansion to Final Fantasy 14 's first major story arc, the Hydaelyn-Zodiark Saga. Additional criticisms of Final Fantasy 14 have recently been aimed at the game's Online Store selections, with players questioning the quality and pricing of certain cosmetics, including the Crystarium Rebel's Attire and the Belt-leather Attire.

Final Fantasy 14 Lost Both Subscribers And Money

Following the first anniversary of Dawntrail , Square Enix's Q1 2025 financial report stated that the expansion's mixed response hurt the company's bottom line. According to Square Enix shareholder Yuzu (and translated by Aitaikimochi on Twitter), MMO gross sales for both Final Fantasy 14 and Dragon Quest 10 dropped by 2.9 billion yen ($19.6 million) compared to Q1 2024, and operational profits were down 3 billion yen ($20.2 million) as well. Yuzu stated that the success of Square Enix's HD game sales hinges on Final Fantasy 14 's own success, and stated that something must be done for the MMORPG to regain momentum. While Square Enix's stock prices have trended upward, Yuzu dismissed it as an accurate method of gauging the company's financial health, stating that activists have inflated prices.

Along with the decrease in year-on-year profits, the drop in interest was felt within Final Fantasy 14 itself. After several months of inactivity, the game's automatic housing demolition system was turned on in June. Hundreds of virtual homes were deleted in late July on North American data centers like Aether and Crystal, granting active Final Fantasy 14 players a chance to claim a vacant lot. As of this writing, player housing in Final Fantasy 14 continues to be available on a per-server basis.

Despite the gloomy outlook, Final Fantasy 14 recently launched Patch 7.3, which was billed as Dawntrail 's climactic story update. Although early player sentiment toward Patch 7.3 is leaning in a positive direction, only time will tell what Final Fantasy 14 will do to turn things around heading into its next expansion.

item.title: Times Video Game Censorship Triggered The Streisand Effect
item.description:
Video game censorship has always been a hot topic, and it still resurfaces from time to time. Many titles with violent gameplay or suggestive content have become hotbeds of controversy, as people unfamiliar with gaming vilify these products as corrupting influences. Of course, this is just one of the many reasons why video games are censored, sometimes to the point where people end up noticing things that developers and studios are trying to draw attention away from.

This leads to the Streisand Effect, where the act of trying to cover something up leads to more eyes being pointed toward an issue than ever before. This phenomenon has affected the realm of video games many times and, in some cases, changed video game history.

Konami Refusing To Let Anyone Experience P.T.'s Excellence

An Ugly Breakup That Became Even More Talked-About After This Puzzling Move

P.T.
Survival Horror
Systems
5.5 /10
Released
August 12, 2014
ESRB
m

Powered by

P.T. is one of the most influential horror games ever made, but the rift between Kojima and Konami led to the developer annihilating this game from the PS4 for good. However, instead of burying this incredible horror game, this move only grew P.T. 's legacy to new heights.

This lost horror game became even more legendary as a result, leading to the rise of anomaly horror games and generating greater interest in the horror genre than ever. It isn't a stretch to say that Resident Evil 7 would never have been so successful had P.T. 's release and deletion from the PlayStation Store not left a void that this game could occupy.

Hatred Being Delisted From Steam

Came Back With An Apology From Lord Gabe Himself

Hatred
Shoot 'em Up
Systems
3 /10
Released
June 1, 2015
ESRB
AO For Adult Only 18+ Due To Intense Violence, Blood and Gore, Strong Language

Powered by

Hatred intentionally stirred up a ton of controversy by marketing itself as a genocide simulator. The game itself isn't that special, but the violent content and the coverage it received ensured that more people would check out this title than anyone could have expected.

It didn't help that Steam tried to censor this game by delisting it from their store, only to anger fans. The fact that Gabe Newell personally apologized to players before bringing Hatred back to Steam definitely had a huge role to play in bolstering its sales, too.

Mass Effect Legendary Edition Changing A Certain Angle When Talking To Miranda

Brought More Eyes Toward This Particular Situation

Mass Effect: Legendary Edition
9 /10
12
9.7 /10
Released
May 14, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

Many remastered editions of popular titles try to change certain aspects to fit the modern climate. In the case of Mass Effect Legendary Edition , the remaster made a small change to one dialogue exchange with Miranda Lawson that fans picked up on in no time.

The original game showed a flattering shot of Miranda's posterior, something that was removed in the remake. As subtle as it was, fans picked up on this change in no time, and it made the rounds on social media not long after.

Night Trap Is Popular Mainly Because Of Its Controversy

The Only Reason People Still Talk About This Game

3 Images
3 Images
Night Trap
Adventure
Strategy
Systems
Released
October 15, 1992

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Night Trap is far from a great video game, but it attained notoriety for different reasons. The gameplay loop of saving vulnerable girls from masked kidnappers stirred up a ton of controversy, and called for demands to censor or ban the game outright.

This conversation was so long and protracted that it eventually led to the rise of the ESRB system, the rating scale that is now widely used across the video game industry. Without this discussion, it's very much possible that Night Trap would have become yet another forgotten mediocre video game. Instead, it has accrued a reputation as one of the most important video games that shaped this landscape.

Manhunt Was So Violent That It Was Banned

More People Found Out Just How Violent This Game's Executions Were

Manhunt
7.8 /10
Released
November 18, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Rockstar is no stranger to controversy, but it can't be stated enough how notorious Manhunt was when it launched. The game was banned in several regions and became controversial for how violent and sickening the content seemed to outsiders.

In a way, this added to Manhunt 's legend, with the discussion leading to more people checking out James Earl Cash's adventures for themselves. This sickening tale is as dark and bloody as they come, but this isn't necessarily a bad thing . Manhunt makes the most of its somber atmosphere to immerse players.

South Park: The Stick Of Truth Lampoons Regional Censorship Laws

See Koalas And Statues Crying While Being Told About Censored Scenes

South Park: The Stick of Truth
8 /10
7.4 /10
Released
March 4, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Violence
Powered by

Considering the cartoon it's based on, it was only a given that South Park: The Stick of Truth would face a tough time with video game censorship laws. But instead of outright removing content, Trey and Matt settled on a hilarious solution.

Moments that were censored for Australian and EU markets featured a crying koala and a statue, respectively, as the game told players in a humorous manner what they were missing out on. This became popular for embodying the classic South Park spirit, and it ensured that the game would be interesting to play for more players, including those who aren't necessarily South Park fans.

Mortal Kombat Faced A Censorship Controversy For The Ages

The Fatalities Have Become A Mainstay Of The Series

6 Images
6 Images
Mortal Kombat (1992)
7.5 /10
Released
October 6, 1992

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Mortal Kombat is the poster child of controversial games, with the first few games being censored by either removing blood, changing the blood's color, or the games being banned outright. This game, along with Night Trap , sparked the video game censorship debate that led to the ESRB system.

The fatalities of Mortal Kombat were the biggest talking point that was criticized by supporters of the game's ban. These people would be in shock if they saw just how gruesome and bloody the fatalities in modern Mortal Kombat games are, considering how far graphics have come since 1992.

Trying To Censor NSFW Games Is Having The Opposite Effect

Freedom Of Expression Has Become A Major Talking Point

A huge topic in the gaming industry right now is how payment platforms are forcing Steam and other video game platforms to remove all NSFW games from their library. This development arose after Collective Shout started pressuring video game platforms to remove these suspect games.

As a result, fans are lashing back and asking questions about where this video game censorship will draw the line. The fact that this has become a major news story that is developing to this day makes it clear that Steam and itch.io won't have an easy time sweeping all this under the rug.

item.title: Best Action JRPGs That Let You Play With Friends
item.description:
Summary

  • Action JRPGs tend to be solitary, but some games like Dragon's Crown offer accessible multiplayer options for up to four players online.
  • Classic JRPG franchises like Dragon Quest Heroes 2 have incorporated four-player co-op options for a more engaging experience.
  • From games like Collection of Mana to Elden Ring, there are varied options for co-op gameplay in JRPGs to enjoy with friends, partners, or strangers.

Action JRPGs are mostly solitary affairs, like Final Fantasy 7 Remake or any of the Yakuza games. Western RPGs tend to incorporate multiplayer more often in their games, like Diablo 4 and Borderlands 2 . That doesn't mean there aren't any good action JRPG recommendations for those who wish to play a game with a friend, partner, or stranger.

Some examples date back to the SNES days and still come with a few caveats. With that in mind, let's go down the big list of JRPGs and see which franchises or one-offs had co-op included . Are they worth it, or does multiplayer clutter the gameplay mechanics? Let's find out.

Collection of Mana

Two Classic SNES JRPGs

Collection of Mana
9.0 /10
Released
August 27, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes
Powered by
  • Multiplayer Options : Two-Three Local

Collection of Mana is a collection of the first three Mana games, including Final Fantasy Adventure , which has no multiplayer. Secret of Mana does, though, just like the SNES original, where three players can enjoy the campaign together.

Getting Trials of Mana as part of the collection was significant, as this SNES game has remained officially hidden from the West for decades. Players can choose who they start with in Trials of Mana , and eventually, two-player co-op opens up in the campaign.

Dragon’s Crown

Crossplay Possibilities

Dragon's Crown
Action RPG
Systems
Released
August 6, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by
  • Multiplayer Options : Four Online/Four Local

Dragon’s Crown is one of Vanillaware’s finest action JRPGs, and it emphasizes multiplayer above everything else. Players can take control of typical RPG classes like mages and warriors, and hunt down loot within dungeons. Four players can group up together online or locally, making it one of the most accessible co-op experiences around.

Plus, thanks to the PS4 port that came later on, all consoles can play Dragon's Crown together, including the past PS3 and PS Vita versions. What it lacks in story it more than makes up for with its gameplay hooks.

Dragon Quest Heroes 2

A Classic JRPG Gets Co-Op

Dragon Quest Heroes 2
7 /10
8.0 /10
Released
April 25, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Fantasy Violence, Game Experience May Change During Online Play, Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by
  • Multiplayer Options : Four Online

Dragon Quest Heroes 2 is a spinoff of the Dragon Quest series and the Musou games made under Koei Tecmo’s umbrella. It’s one of the few Musou games that offers four-player co-op, whereas most titles typically have two-player co-op, including Dynasty Warriors, Fire Emblem Warriors, Hyrule Warriors, and Samurai Warriors .

Multiplayer numbers aside, Dragon Quest Heroes 2 is just a good game with a lot of clever references to the series, from monsters to heroes. It may get repetitive like most Musou games that throw hundreds of enemies at players, but that’s why co-op can help smooth things out, as battles will clear faster.

Elden Ring

Survive The Lands Between Together

Elden Ring
10 /10
68
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by
  • Multiplayer Options : Three Online

Elden Ring is most definitely FromSoftware’s most successful game, so much so that they even created a multiplayer roguelike spinoff called Elden Ring Nightreign . The original game can be played in multiplayer too, and is a better experience for some because it is not as intense as it is in single-player.

Players can summon up to two friends to explore the open-world environments. After a boss, online friends will typically disappear, but they can be recalled moments later. It’s often better to play a Soulslike with a friend to make things easier, and there aren’t many better options than Elden Ring .

Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time

A Casual Co-Op Experience

Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time
9.2 /10
Released
May 21, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone // Mild Fantays Violence
Powered by
  • Multiplayer Options : Four Online/Two Local

Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time is the latest game from Level-5, and it plays similarly to the first game in the series, which was released on the 3DS. Players take on the role of classes, called Lives, which turn them into noble warriors or handy fishermen.

It takes some time to get going, but eventually, players will unlock a multiplayer mode that is separate from the campaign. They can explore dungeons with friends locally or online, and while that's not as robust as full campaign co-op, dungeon crawling is still a good time with company.

Granblue Fantasy: Relink

An Under The Radar JRPG

Granblue Fantasy: Relink
8.0 /10
Released
February 1, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by
  • Multiplayer Options : Four Online

Granblue Fantasy: Relink flew a bit under the radar when it was released in 2024. It’s a shame it didn’t reach the heights of other action JRPGs that year, like Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , but every great underrated game typically has its comeback moment.

The campaign can only be played alone and offline, with three AI-controlled party members assisting the hero. However, there is a quest counter wherein players can tackle bite-sized quests with three others online to help with their progression. Non-story co-op is always unfortunate, but at least Granblue Fantasy: Relink offers some form of multiplayer.

Monster Hunter Wilds

Hunt Monsters And Look Good Doing It

Monster Hunter Wilds
58
8.2 /10
Released
February 28, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Blood, Crude Humor
Powered by
  • Multiplayer Options : Four Online

Monster Hunter Wilds is more inviting than other games in the Monster Hunter series, as it provides AI-controlled partners for the first time. It's a nice option to have that makes things easier for solo players, but this series has always been about questing together with random people or friends online.

Four players can group together on specific monster hunts, or they can choose a quest option to explore the world together and collect materials if they are feeling less inclined towards fighting. It's a nice option to have as a diversion, although the main draw will always be taking on monster hunts.

Stranger Of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin

Many Fantasies To Check Out

Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin
7 /10
Released
March 18, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by
  • Multiplayer Options : Three Online

Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin is both a prequel to and a remake of the first game in the series, which was developed as a Soulslike. Unlike other Soulslikes, including Elden Ring , Stranger of Paradise: Final Fantasy Origin is not too difficult to complete alone, thanks to the difficulty settings.

Players can go into campaign missions alone or with two other friends online. What makes the gameplay hooks fun in this spinoff is the Job system, which alters equipment and skill loadouts for deep customization. The three main Final Fantasy Crystal Chronicles games and Final Fantasy Explorers are also good options for players looking for a co-op Final Fantasy game.
